--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Micha=
el Stack <stack@...> wrote:
>
> Your second mail 'seems' to describe a diff=
erent phenomenon.  After 
> fetchers are finished, extractors go to work an=
d get a character stream 
> on the fetchers' download (A ReplayCharSequence=
).   If we determine
it a 
> multi-byte stream, we first convert downloaded=
 bytes to a CharSequence 
> writing the encoding to a temporary file -- the=
 one with the UTF-16BE 
> suffix -- and its this file we pass back to the e=
xtractor to run its 
> character-based regexes across.  When an extractor i=
s done, its
supposed 
> to clean up the temporary file.  The delete is fail=
ing silently?  Just 
> before the delete, there is a log ('...because of...=
').  Whats it
say in 
> your case?
> 
> Thanks,
> St.Ack
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> b=
